definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: It's not that easy, buddy, not when people's lifestyles are at stake.
sentences.chinese: 沒那麼容易的，夥計，人類都是不見棺材不掉淚的。

sentences.english: Every time I see the movie, it brings tears to my eyes.
There are many reasons why Internet addiction exists. But to deny its existence is to see no evil and hear no evil.
sentences.chinese: 在我看來，否認網癮的存在，實屬見了棺材也不掉淚。

sentences.english: I glared at the dancing water, sprayed in the air, suddenly burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 我直直望着噴在空中，不斷跳躍的水滴，突然掉淚。

sentences.english: Tang sugar think super tears again.
sentences.chinese: 唐糖想着超羣又掉淚了。

sentences.english: You'll weep as you await the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 你可能邊等結果邊掉淚。

definition: dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to pretend to look happy/to force oneself to smile
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
ashamed and unable to show one's face
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
